Summary Graduate research assistant working in the International Center for Air Transportation (ICAT) Lab and pursuing a MS in Aeronautical and Astronautical Engineering at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Research has a focus on predictive modeling for airports in the northeastern US region. Models will be integrated with tactical decision-support tools, used to set Airport Arrival Rates (AARs), and used to evaluate inter-aircraft spacing on runways in real-time.  
 
 
Has a particular interest in entrepreneurship, and works with early stage startups out of the Martin Trust Center for MIT Entrepreneurship. Currently, founded a company called GradAdvisor that helps graduate students reach both their academic and research goals and requirements.  
 
 
Graduated with a BS in Mechanical Engineering at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign with Highest Honors. Industry experience includes engineering work for Boeing Defense, Space, & Security (BDS), Boeing Commercial Airplanes (BCA), GE Aviation Systems, and Marathon Petroleum Company. 
 
 
 
Specialties:  
The Thermal Fluid Sciences, Predictive Modeling, Project Management, Team Management, Thermal Modeling 
 
 
Relevant Coursework:  
Advanced Fluid Mechanics, Advanced Heat and Mass Transfer, Gas Dynamics, Thermodynamics, Aircraft Propulsion Systems, Energy Systems, Flight Vehicle Aerodynamics, Demand Modeling, and Disciplined Entrepreneurship.
